contentrichtext.text: {{About||Itami Airport|Osaka International Airport|the film director|Juzo Itami}} {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Itami |JapaneseName= 伊丹市 |MapImage= Itami in Hyogo Prefecture Ja.svg |Region= [[Kansai region|Kansai]] |Prefecture= [[Hyōgo Prefecture|Hyogo]] |District= |Area_km2= 24.97 |PopDate= January 2008 |Population= 194,488 |Density_km2= 7790 |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 34 |LatitudeMinutes= 47 |LatitudeSeconds= |LongtitudeDegrees= 135 |LongtitudeMinutes= 24 |LongtitudeSeconds= |Tree= |Flower= [[Azalea]] |Bird= [[Duck]] |SymbolImage= Flag of Itami, Hyogo.png |SymbolDescription= Flag |Mayor= [[Yasuyuki Fujiwara]] |CityHallPostalCode=664-8503 |CityHallAddress= 1-1 Senzo, Itami-shi, Hyōgo-ken |CityHallPhone= 072-784-8011 |CityHallLink= [http://www.city.itami.lg.jp City of Itami] }} {{nihongo|'''Itami'''|伊丹市|Itami-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Hyōgo Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. As of 2008, the city had an estimated [[population]] of 194,488 and a [[population density]] of 7,790 persons per km². The total area is 24.97 km². The center of Itami became a wealthy town by the middle of [[Sengoku]] period. It was named Itami-go (town of Itami) and known as the only Japanese town within a castle (usually Japanese castles were located far from domestic areas). Itami-go was a part of Castle Arioka which Araki Murashige ruled under [[Oda Nobunaga]]. After the uprising and defeat of Araki, the castle was torn down. Today's city was established on 10 November 1940. Great portions of the city were damaged in the [[Great Hanshin Awaji earthquake]] of 1995, but were quickly rebuilt. Most of [[Osaka International Airport]] is located in Itami (hence the common name "Itami Airport"): it is [[Osaka]]'s primary domestic airport, although all international flights and many domestic flights shifted to [[Kansai International Airport]] in 1994. Despite the airport's association with Itami, the terminal complex in truth sits in the neighboring city of [[Toyonaka, Osaka|Toyonaka]], and the Itami city center is connected to the airport only by a long [[tunnel]] that passes beneath the runway and tarmac. The city is also famous for Koyaike Park, which features a large model of the [[Japan]]ese archipelago set in a circular pond. The park is a frequent sight for passengers on flights into Itami Airport. Moreover, Itami is one of the important [[sake]]-brewing cities in Japan. Some historians claimed Itami was the place where seishu, clear sake, was invented. On January 20, 2009, a 69-year-old man injured in a traffic accident in Itami died after paramedics spent more than an hour negotiating with 14 hospitals before one admitted him.<ref name="man_died">[http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090204/ap_on_re_as/as_japan_medical_care_denied Injured man dies after rejection by 14 hospitals], Yahoo News / Associated Press.</ref> Itami sits on the [[Hankyu Railway]] [[Hankyu Itami Line|Itami Line]] and the [[JR Takarazuka Line]] ([[Fukuchiyama Line]]). Sister city is [[Hasselt]], [[Belgium]]. ==Notable people== *[[Aiko Uemura]], mogul skier *[[Aki Okui]], singer-songwriter *[[Akira Ueda]], voice actor *[[Hayato Sakamoto]], baseball player *[[Hirotoshi Kitagawa]], baseball player *[[Hiroyuki Nakajima]], baseball player *[[Katsuki Yamazaki]], baseball player *[[Masahiro Tanaka]], baseball player *[[Masami Okui]], singer *[[Natsumi Horiguchi]], volleyball player *[[Sae Nakarai]], weather presenter *[[Seiko Tanabe]], novelist *[[Tokindo Okada]], biologist *[[Toshinori Tsubouchi]], poet *[[Yasushi Maeda]], comedian *[[Yoko Minamino]], actress *[[Yuki Suzue]], baseball player == References == <references/> == External links == {{Commons category|Itami, Hyogo}} *[http://www.city.itami.lg.jp/_8003.html Itami official website] {{Hyogo}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Itami, Hyogo}} [[Category:Cities in Hyōgo Prefecture]]
